rooms.name: Lobby & Living Area
rooms.description: A spacious entrance area that doubles as a living space featuring a mix of Bohemian decor with vibrant colors, local textiles, and indoor plants. The room is designed to maximize natural light through large windows and skylights, in line with Vastu principles for open spaces.

rooms.name: Kitchen & Dining
rooms.description: An integrated kitchen area with an adjacent dining space that utilizes an L-shaped layout to ensure efficient circulation. Natural ventilation is prioritized through cross-ventilation windows; local sustainable materials are used, reflecting a Bohemian aesthetic.

openings.details: Large, south-facing windows in the living area and kitchen to maximize natural light as per Vastu guidelines.
A centrally located entrance door with decorative detailing reflective of Indian traditional motifs.

rooms.name: Master Bedroom Suite
rooms.description: A Bohemian-themed master bedroom suite that offers ample natural light and a private balcony overlooking the garden. The room is designed for relaxation with local artisanal finishes.

rooms.name: Guest Room
rooms.description: A multifunctional guest room that can also serve as an office space, featuring natural ventilation and abundant daylight through strategically placed windows.

openings.details: Balconies integrated in the master bedroom and guest room to enhance natural light and provide outdoor views.
North-facing windows designed for privacy while ensuring adequate ventilation.

rooms.name: Studio & Home Theater
rooms.description: A dedicated studio space that doubles as a home theater, incorporating soundproofing techniques and ambient lighting. The design embraces Bohemian artistic influences with recycled furniture and local art installations.

rooms.name: Study/Work Area
rooms.description: An additional work area within the studio that is well-ventilated and designed to optimize productivity using natural light from floor-to-ceiling windows.

openings.details: Floor-to-ceiling windows on one side of the room to maximize natural light, adhering to Vastu guidelines for energy flow.
A soundproof door separating the home theater from the living area to prevent disturbances.
